{"step_by_step_thinking": "Dysphonia plica ventricularis is a condition where the false vocal cords, also known as the ventricular folds, vibrate to produce sound instead of the true vocal cords. The true vocal cords are typically responsible for sound production, but in this condition, they are bypassed. The ventricle of the larynx and the tongue are not directly involved in sound production in this condition.", "answer_choice": "A"}
